head.title: Firefighter Charged In Potential Cocaine Sale

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Firefighter Charged In Potential Cocaine Sale

abstract.p: Veteran Brooklyn firefighter George Bechman is arrested and charged with possession of cocaine with intent to sell it; Parks Department employee Randolph Hayes is also arrested (S)

block.p: A veteran Brooklyn firefighter, George Bechman, 49, was arrested yesterday and charged with possession of cocaine with intent to sell it, the authorities said.

A Parks Department employee, Randolph Hayes, who the police said sold 15 grams of cocaine to Firefighter Bechman in front of the firehouse, was arrested as part of the same investigation after the police found more than a kilogram of cocaine and $20,000 in his home, officials said.
A veteran Brooklyn firefighter, George Bechman, 49, was arrested yesterday and charged with possession of cocaine with intent to sell it, the authorities said.

A Parks Department employee, Randolph Hayes, who the police said sold 15 grams of cocaine to Firefighter Bechman in front of the firehouse, was arrested as part of the same investigation after the police found more than a kilogram of cocaine and $20,000 in his home, officials said.

Firefighter Bechman was immediately suspended without pay from his post at Ladder Company 148 on 12th Avenue and 42nd Street in Sunset Park, where he has spent his entire 21-year career, officials said.
An investigator said that Mr. Hayes, 40, of Bensonhurst, had been the subject of a long investigation by the Brooklyn South Narcotics Task Force.
